processing_notes: Source states: 'In 2005, there were 31,719 cholera cases with 458 deaths in the Republic of Senegal' - interpreted as sCh cases with confirmed deaths
Source states: 'From January 1-March 23, 2005, the Ministry of Health reported 2,054 cases and 8 deaths' - interpreted as sCh cases early outbreak period
Source states: 'From 27 June to 3 July 2005, Ministry of Health reported 469 cases and 4 deaths (case fatality rate 0.9%)' - interpreted as sCh cases weekly period
Source states: 'From 3 August 2007 to 14 October 2007, 2,144 cholera cases were registered with 11 deaths, a lethality rate of 0.51%' - interpreted as sCh cases
Source states: 'Since 2004, Senegal has reported cholera cases every year, with 1,263 cases in 2008' - interpreted as sCh cases annual total
Source states: 'À l'hôpital Fann de Dakar, sur 934 malades vus en consultation...323 cas ont été confirmés par coproculture' - interpreted as 934 sCh and 323 cCh cases
Source states: 'Cholera cases were not recorded in Senegal during 2009' - interpreted as zero-transmission period validated by surveillance
Source states: 'Since 2009, Senegal has reported only 13 suspected cholera cases' - interpreted as sCh cases total 2009-2015 period
Source states: 'The absence of recorded cholera cases in Senegal up to 2004' - interpreted as zero-transmission period 2000 validated by surveillance absence
Source states: 'The absence of recorded cholera cases in Senegal up to 2004' - interpreted as zero-transmission period 2001 validated by surveillance absence

Source states: 'The absence of recorded cholera cases in Senegal up to 2004' - interpreted as zero-transmission period 2003 validated by surveillance absence
Source states: 'ten thousand five hundred and sixty five (10,565) stool samples...592 of which were vibrio cholerae' - interpreted as sCh cases from laboratory surveillance decade
Source states: 'Senegal is not mentioned in any current WHO Disease Outbreak News reports for 2024-2025' - interpreted as zero-transmission period validated by current WHO surveillance

Source states: 'A sharp increase in the number of cases has been registered in the district of Mbour with 52 cases reported compared to 14 in the week before' - interpreted as sCh cases weekly district data
Source states: 'Saint Louis city recorded 1,185 cases during the 2004-2005 epidemic' - interpreted as sCh cases municipal outbreak data
Source states: 'in the district of Foundiougne in the region of Saint Louis (region's total of 119 cases, 2 deaths)' - interpreted as sCh cases and deaths district data
Source states: 'Bakel district in the region of Tambacounda is newly affected, with 5 cases reported during this period' - interpreted as sCh cases district data

Source states: 'epidemic started in Dakar and its outskirts as well as in departments such as...Darou Mousty in the Louga region, where more than 861 cases were registered and 6 people died' - interpreted as sCh cases and deaths district data
